sourcesContent:
const Projects = [
  {
    "id": 1,
    "title": "GifnJelly",
    "image": "./assets/images/gifnjelly.gif",
    "body": "This is my first real attempt at a full stack web application. The concept of this project was for users to create their own account and be able to add fun captions to animated gifs. They are also able to vote on gifs from other users. All of the information was stored in a database and I used handlebars as my rendering engine.",
    "gitHub": "https://github.com/TommyWillen/gifNjelly",
    "deployed": "https://mighty-fjord-82642.herokuapp.com/",
    "altTag": "animated gif of the GifnJelly project"
  },
  {
    "id": 2,
    "title": "GameFlix",
    "image": "./assets/images/gameflix.png",
    "body": "This was a collaborative project that asked the used personality questions and returned suggested movie (from TMDB) and video game (from GRAW) options based on their answer. Users could then save their favorite options to view later and remove any they have already seen/played.",
    "gitHub": "https://github.com/TommyWillen/Gameflix",
    "deployed": "https://tommywillen.github.io/Gameflix/",
    "altTag": "image of the GameFlix project"
  },
  {
    "id": 3,
    "title": "REACTive Employee Directory",
    "image": "./assets/images/employee-directory-functionality-gif.gif",
    "body": "This project is my first attempt at a front-end React.js application. I used stateful class components to create this project. The purpose of the project was to create a directory that can sort by first and last name as well as filter the employee list without refreshing the page.",
    "gitHub": "https://github.com/TommyWillen/REACTive-Employee-Directory",
    "deployed": "https://tommywillen.github.io/REACTive-Employee-Directory/",
    "altTag": "animated gif of the REACTive Employee Directory project"
  },
  {
    "id": 4,
    "title": "Offline Friendly Budget Tracker App",
    "image": "./assets/images/budget-tracker-gif.gif",
    "body": "This application originally required the internet to fully function. My task was to utilized service workers and index.db to create offline friendly capabilities for the application so it can be used with or without the internet.",
    "gitHub": "https://github.com/TommyWillen/Offline-Friendly-Budget-Tracker",
    "deployed": "https://stormy-woodland-07307.herokuapp.com/",
    "altTag": "animated gif of the Offline Friendly Budget Tracker App project"
  },
  {
    "id": 5,
    "title": "Weather Dashboard",
    "image": "./assets/images/Weather-Dashboard-Function.gif",
    "body": "For this project I the OpenWeatherMap API to create a weather dashboard where the user can search for a city (by name or by name/state/country) and receive up to date weather information for the location as well as a five-day forecast. This is usefull for travel information.",
    "gitHub": "https://github.com/TommyWillen/Weather-Dashboard",
    "deployed": "https://mighty-fjord-82642.herokuapp.com/",
    "altTag": "animated gif of the Weather Dashboard project"
  },
  {
    "id": 6,
    "title": "JavaScript Quiz",
    "image": "./assets/images/JavaScript-Quiz-Main.gif",
    "body": "This is a quiz game using pure vanilla javascript. The purpose of this was to review concepts related to javascript as well as demonstrate my understanding of the core capabilities of javascript.",
    "gitHub": "https://github.com/TommyWillen/Javascript-Quiz",
    "deployed": "https://tommywillen.github.io/Javascript-Quiz/",
    "altTag": "animated gif of the JavaScript Quiz project"
  }
]

export default Projects
